[Syntax: LOVERLAY=(linetypes)] 
          
Specifies line types for the line segments connecting points on primary chart overlays. 
Line types in the LOVERLAY= list are matched with variables in the corresponding positions 
in the OVERLAY= list.

[Syntax: LOVERLAY2=(linetypes)] 
          
Specifies line types for the line segments connecting points on secondary chart 
overlays. Line types in the LOVERLAY2= list are matched with variables in the 
corresponding positions in the OVERLAY2= list.

[Syntax: LSL=value-list] 
          
Provides lower specification limits used to compute capability indices.

[Syntax: LSTARCIRCLES=linetypes] 
          
Specifies one or more line types for the circles requested with the STARCIRCLES= option.

[Syntax: LSTARS=linetype | LSTARS=(variable)] 
          
Specifies the line types for the outlines of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= 
option.

[Syntax: LTESTS=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the line segments that connect patterns of points for 
which a test for special causes (requested with the TESTS= option) is positive. The 
default is 1, which produces a solid line.

[Syntax: LTMARGIN=value] 
          
Specifies the width of the left marginal area for the plot requested with the 
LTMPLOT= option.

Requests a univariate plot of the control chart statistics that is positioned in the 
left margin of the control chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Histogram
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Digidot plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Schematic box-and-whisker plot with outliers labeled
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Schematic box-and-whisker plot with far outliers labeled

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: LVREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for reference lines requested by the VREF= and VREF2= options. The default 
value is 2, which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: LZONES=n] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines that delineate zones A, B, and C for standard tests 
requested with the TESTS= and/or TESTS2= options. The default is n=2, which produces a 
dashed line.

[Syntax: MAXPANELS=n] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of pages or screens for a chart. By default, n=20.

Identifies a method for estimating the process mean, µ, which is represented by the 
central line on a median chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Average of subgroup means
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Average of subgroup medians

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Determines how subgroups are formed when observations are read from a DATA= data set 
and a character subgroup-variable is provided.

Causes the moving range computation on the IRCHART to be restarted when any missing 
value is encountered.

[Syntax: MRRESTART=value] '
          
Causes the moving range computation on the IRCHART to be restarted only when the 
specified missing value is encountered.

[Syntax: MU0=value] 
          
Specifies a known (standard) value u0 for the process mean µ.

[Syntax: NAME='string'] 
          
Specifies a name for the primary chart of length 8 or less that appears in the 
PROC GREPLAY master menu. The default name is 'SHEWHART'.

[Syntax: NAME2='string'] 
          
Specifies a name for the secondary chart of length 8 or less that appears in the 
PROC GREPLAY master menu. The default name is 'SHEWHART'.

[Syntax: NDECIMAL=n] 
          
Specifies the number of decimal digits in the default labels for the control limits 
and the central line in the primary chart.

[Syntax: NDECIMAL2=n] 
          
Specifies the number of decimal digits in the default labels for the control limits and the central 
line in a secondary chart.
Connects plotted points to the central line with vertical line segments (needles).

Identifies a plotted subgroup summary statistic with a special symbol marker (character) 
when the corresponding subgroup sample size is not equal to the nominal control limit 
sample size n.
Suppresses the check for 3σ limits when tests for special causes are requested.
Suppresses block and phase reference lines from ODS Graphics output.

Suppresses the block and phase wall fills from ODS Graphics output. By default, block and phase walls
are filled when ODS Graphics is in effect.

Suppresses the legend for the levels of a BOXFILL= or STARFILL= variable in ODS 
Graphics output.

Specifies that the reference line information in an HREF=, HREF2=, VREF=, or VREF2= 
data set be applied uniformly to box plots created for all the BY groups in the 
input data set. If you specify the NOBYREF option, you do not need to provide BY 
variables in the reference line data set. By default, you must provide BY variables.

Suppresses the creation of the chart. You typically specify the NOCHART option when 
you are using the procedure to compute control limits and save them in an output 
data set.

Suppresses the creation of a secondary chart. You typically use this option in the 
IRCHART statement to create a chart for individual measurements and suppress the 
accompanying chart for moving ranges.
Suppresses line segments that connect points on the chart.
Suppresses the display of the central line in a primary chart.
Suppresses the display of the central line in a secondary chart.
Suppresses the default frame drawn around the chart.
Suppresses the label for the horizontal (subgroup) axis.
Suppresses the display of the lower control limit in a primary chart.
Suppresses the display of the lower control limit in a secondary chart.

Suppresses the default legend for subgroup sample sizes, which appears by default 
below the chart.

Suppresses the display of a fixed lower control limit if and only if the value of 
the limit is zero.

Suppresses the display of a fixed upper control limit on a p chart if and only if 
the value of the control limit is 1 (or 100%), or on an np chart if and only if 
the value of the control limit is n.
Suppresses the default labels for the control limits and central lines.
Suppresses the display of control limits.

Suppresses the default frame for the control limit information that is displayed 
across the top of the chart when multiple sets of control limits with distinct 
multiples of σ and nominal control limit sample sizes are read from a LIMITS= 
data set.

Suppresses the legend for the control limits, which appears by default in the upper 
right corner of the chart.

Suppresses the legend for overlay variables which is displayed by default when the 
OVERLAY= or OVERLAY2= option is specified.
Suppresses the default frame for the legend requested by the PHASELEGEND option.

Specifies that the control limits for each process listed in the chart statement 
are not to be read from the LIMITS= data set specified in the PROC SHEWHART 
statement.

Specifies that box-and-whiskers plots created by the BOXCHART statement are to be 
notched.

Specifies that tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= options 
not be applied across the boundaries of phases (blocks of consecutive subgroups) 
determined by the READPHASES= option and the variable _PHASE_ in the input data 
set.

Applies to character-valued subgroup-variables and specifies that only the first 
occurrence of repeated, adjacent group values be labeled on the horizontal axis.
Disables transparency in ODS Graphics output, so that all graph features are opaque.
Suppresses line segments that connect points on a trend chart.
Overrides the vertical axis truncation at zero.
Suppresses the display of the upper control limit in a primary chart.
suppresses the display of the upper control limit in a secondary chart.
Requests that the vertical axis label be strung out vertically.

[Syntax: NPANELPOS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of subgroup positions per panel on each chart.
Specifies a label for the central line in an np chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: A quoted label up to 16 characters in length.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: NP
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: NP''
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: NP0

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Adds a footnote to ODS Graphics output.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The value of SAS FOOTNOTE statement is used as the graph footnote.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The value of SAS FOOTNOTE statement is used as the graph footnote.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: A quoted string is used as the graph footnote.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Adds a secondary footnote to ODS Graphics output.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The value of SAS FOOTNOTE2 statement is used as the graph footnote.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A quoted string is used as the secondary footnote.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies that legend entries contain all levels observed in the data.
Specifies a title for ODS Graphics output.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Uses the value of SAS TITLE statement as the graph title.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Uses the value of SAS TITLE statement as the graph title.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Suppresses all titles from the graph.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Uses the default ODS Graphics title (a descriptive title consisting of the plot type and the process variable name.)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Uses the default ODS Graphics title with the variable label instead of the variable name.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: A quoted string is used as the graph title.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies a secondary title for ODS Graphics output.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Uses the value of SAS TITLE2 statement as the secondary graph title.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A quoted string is used as the secondary title.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: OUTBOX=SAS-data-set] 
          
Creates an output data set that contains subgroup summary statistics, control limits, and outlier 
values for a box chart.

Fills the areas outside the control limits that lie between the connected points and the control 
limits and are bounded by connecting lines.

[Syntax: OUTFILLOPACITY=value] 
          
Specifies the control limit outfill opacity when transparency is used in ODS Graphics 
output. The value must be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is 
completely opaque. The default control limit outfill opacity is 0.25.

[Syntax: OUTHIGHHTML=variable] 
          
Specifies a variable whose values are URLs to be associated with outlier points 
above the upper fence on a schematic box plot when graphics output is directed 
into HTML.

[Syntax: OUTHISTORY=SAS-data-set] 
          
Creates an output data set that contains the subgroup summary statistics.

[Syntax: OUTINDEX='label'] 
          
Specifies the value of the _INDEX_ variable in the OUTLIMITS= output data set.

[Syntax: OUTLABEL=VALUE | OUTLABEL=(variable)] 
          
Labels each point that falls outside the control limits on the primary chart with the VALUE plotted 
for that subgroup or with the value of a variable in the input data set.

[Syntax: OUTLABEL2=VALUE | OUTLABEL2=(variable)] 
          
Labels each point that falls outside the control limits on an R or s chart with the VALUE plotted 
for that subgroup or with the value of a variable in the input data set.

[Syntax: OUTLIMITS=SAS-data-set] 
          
Creates an output data set that saves the control limits.

[Syntax: OUTLOWHTML=variable] 
          
Specifies a variable whose values are URLs to be associated with outlier points 
below the lower fence on a schematic box plot when graphics output is directed 
into HTML.

[Syntax: OUTPHASE='label'] 
          
Specifies the value of the _PHASE_ variable in the OUTHISTORY= data set.

[Syntax: OUTTABLE=SAS-data-set] 
          
Creates an output SAS data set that saves the information plotted on the chart, 
including the subgroup variable values and their corresponding summary statistics 
and control limits.

[Syntax: OVERLAY=(variable-list)] 
          
Specifies variables to be overlaid on the primary control chart.

[Syntax: OVERLAY2=(variable-list)] 
          
Specifies variables to be overlaid on a secondary control chart.

[Syntax: OVERLAY2HTML=(variable-list)] 
          
Specifies variables whose values are URLs to be associated with points on secondary 
chart overlays.

[Syntax: OVERLAY2ID=(variable-list)] 
          
Specifies variables whose formatted values are used to label points on secondary 
chart overlays.

[Syntax: OVERLAY2SYM=(symbol-list)] 
          
Specifies symbols used to plot overlays on a secondary control chart.

[Syntax: OVERLAYCLIPSYM=symbol] 
          
Specifies the symbol used to plot clipped values on overlay plots when the CLIPFACTOR= 
option is used.

[Syntax: OVERLAYCLIPSYMHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height for the symbol used to plot clipped values on overlay plots 
when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

[Syntax: OVERLAYHTML=(variable-list)] 
          
Specifies variables whose values are URLs to be associated with points on primary 
chart overlays.

[Syntax: OVERLAYID=(variable-list)] 
          
Specifies variables whose formatted values are used to label points on primary 
chart overlays.

[Syntax: OVERLAYLEGLAB='label'] 
          
Specifies the label displayed to the left of the overlay legend produced by the 
OVERLAY= or OVERLAY2= option. The label can be up to 16 characters and must be 
enclosed in quotes. The default label is "Overlays:".

[Syntax: OVERLAYSYM=(symbol-list)] 
          
Specifies symbols used to plot overlays on the primary control chart.

[Syntax: OVERLAYSYMHT=(value-list)] 
          
Specifies the heights of symbols used to plot overlays on the primary control chart.

[Syntax: P0=value] 
          
Specifies a known (standard) value po for the proportion of nonconforming items 
produced by the process.

[Syntax: PAGENUM='string'] 
          
Specifies the form of the label used for pagination. The string can be up to 16 
characters, and it must include one or two occurrences of the substitution character 
'#'. The first '#' is replaced with the page number, and the optional second '#' is 
replaced with the total number of pages.
Specifies where to position the page number requested with the PAGENUM= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Top left
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Top right
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Top left. TL100 ensures that the page number appears at the very top of a page when  a title is displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Top right. TR100 ensures that the page number appears at the very top of a page when  a title is displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Bottom left. BL0 ensures that the page number appears at the very bottom of a page  when footnotes are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Bottom right. BR0 ensures that the page number appears at the very bottom of a page  when footnotes are displayed.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies one of five definitions used to calculate percentiles in the construction of box-and-whiskers plots
requested with the BOXCHART statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Definition 1 for computing quantile statistics
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Definition 2 for computing quantile statistics
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Definition 5 for computing quantile statistics

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Draws phase labels as titles along the top of phase boxes.

Specifies that the last point in a phase (defined as a block of consecutive subgroups 
with the same value of the _PHASE_ variable) is not to be connected to the first point 
in the next phase.

Specifies how lengthy _PHASE_ variable values are to be displayed when there is 
insufficient space in the legend requested with the PHASELEGEND option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The values are uniformly reduced in height so that they fit.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Lengthy values are truncated on the right until they fit.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Identifies the phases requested with the READPHASES= option in a legend across the 
top of the chart.

Specifies that the control limits and center line are to be labeled for each phase 
specified with the READPHASES= option, providing the limits are constant within 
that phase.

[Syntax: PHASEMEANSYMBOL=symbol] 
          
Specifies a symbol marker for the average of the values plotted within a phase.
Specifies the vertical position of the phase legend.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Top of chart, offset from axis frame
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Top of chart, immediately above axis frame
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Bottom of chart, immediately above horizontal axis
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Bottom of chart, below horizontal axis label

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Delineates the phases specified with the READPHASES= option with reference lines 
drawn vertically.

Enables you to associate phase reference lines (block reference lines) with either 
the innermost or the outermost level.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Associates phase reference lines (block reference lines) with the innermost level.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Associates phase reference lines (block reference lines) with the outermost level.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: No association of phase reference lines (block reference lines) with the innermost  or outermost level.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Displays the label associated with the variable _PHASE_ above the phase values in 
the phase legend.
Displays vertical lines separating phase values in the phase legend.

[Syntax: POINTSHTML=variable] 
          
Specifies a variable whose values are URLs to be associated with points on a box chart when the BOXSTYLE= 
value is POINTS, POINTSJOIN, POINTSBOX, POINTSID, or POINTSJOINID.
Specifies a label for the central line in a P chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: P
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: PBAR
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Po
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Estimates the process standard deviation for a boxplot using subgroup ranges.

Specifies that the variable _ALPHA_, rather than the variable _SIGMAS_, is to be read 
from a LIMITS= data set when both variables are available in the data set.

[Syntax: READINDEX=value-list | ALL] 
          
Reads one or more sets of control limits from a LIMITS= data set (specified in the PROC SHEWHART statement)
for each process listed in the chart statement.

Specifies that the control limits are to be read from a LIMITS= data set specified 
in the PROC SHEWHART statement.

[Syntax: READPHASES=value-list | ALL] 
          
Selects blocks of consecutive observations to be read from the input data set.

Specifies that the horizontal axis of a chart that spans multiple panels be arranged 
so that the last subgroup position on a panel is repeated as the first subgroup 
position on the next panel.
Specifies a label for the central line in an R chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: R
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: RBAR
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: RTMARGIN=value] 
          
Specifies the width of the right marginal area for the plot requested with the RTMPLOT= option.

Requests a univariate plot of the control chart statistics that is positioned in the right margin of 
the control chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Digidot plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Histogram
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Schematic box-and-whisker plot with outliers labeled
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Schematic box-and-whisker plot with far outliers labeled

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Displays primary and secondary charts on separate screens or pages.
Adds serifs to the whiskers of skeletal box-and-whisker charts.

[Syntax: SIGMA0=value] 
          
Specifies a known (standard) value, σ0, for the process standard deviation, σ.

[Syntax: SIGMAS=k] 
          
Specifies the width of the control limits in terms of the multiple k of the standard 
error of the subgroup summary statistic plotted on the chart. The value of k must be 
positive. By default, k=3.
Draws the central line labels using a simulated software font rather than a hardware font.

[Syntax: SKIPHLABELS=n] 
          
Specifies the number n of consecutive tick mark labels, beginning with the second 
tick mark label, that are thinned (not displayed) on the horizontal (subgroup) axis.
Specifies a method for estimating the process standard deviation, σ.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Estimates σ as an unweighted average of unbiased subgroup estimates of σ.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Calculates a minimum variance linear unbiased estimate for σ
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Calculates a root-mean square estimate for σ
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Calculates a median absolute deviation estimate for σ (IRCHART only)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Calculates a median moving range estimate for σ (IRCHART only)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Estimates σ based on a moving range of subgroup means (XRCHART and XSCHART only)

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SPLIT='character'] 
          
Specifies a special character that is inserted into the label of a process variable or summary 
statistic variable and whose purpose is to split the label into two parts.
Specifies a label for the central line in an S chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: S
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: SBAR
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: STARBDRADIUS=value] 
          
Specifies the radius of an imaginary circle that is the outer bound for vertices of 
stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

[Syntax: STARCIRCLES=values] 
          
Specifies reference circles that are superimposed on the stars requested with the 
STARVERTICES= option.

[Syntax: STARINRADIUS=value] 
          
Specifies the inner radius of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option. For 
traditional graphics, the radius is specified in horizontal percent screen units. 
For ODS Graphics output, the radius is specified in pixels.

[Syntax: STARFILL=variable] 
          
Specifies colors for filling the interior of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= 
option.

Specifies a method for labeling the vertices of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= 
option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Labels all vertices of all stars.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Labels all vertices of the leftmost star.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Labels only vertices that lie outside the outer circle.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Labels only vertices that lie inside the inner circle.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Labels only vertices that lie inside the inner circle or outside the outer circle.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies the style of the legend used to identify the vertices of stars requested with the 
STARVERTICES= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Identifies the vertex variables by their positions on the clock (starting with 12:00)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Identifies the vertex variables by their positions on the clock (starting with 0:00)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Identifies the vertex variables by angles in degrees, with 0 degrees corresponding to 12 o'clock

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: STARLEGENDLAB='label'] 
          
Specifies the label displayed to the left of the legend for stars requested with the 
STARLEGEND= option. The label can be up to 16 characters and must be enclosed in quotes.

[Syntax: STAROPACITY=value] 
          
Specifies the star fill opacity when transparency is used in ODS Graphics output. 
The value must be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is 
completely opaque. The default star fill opacity is 0.75.

[Syntax: STAROUTRADIUS=value] 
          
Specifies the outer radius of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

[Syntax: STARS=variable] 
          
Specifies colors for the outlines of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

[Syntax: STARSPECS=value|SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies the method used to standardize the star vertex variables listed with 
the STARVERTICES= option.

[Syntax: STARSTART=value] 
          
Specifies the vertex angle for the first variable in the STARVERTICES= list.
Specifies the style of the stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Polygon with star-vertices emanating from the inner circle
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Closed polygon
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Rays emanating from the inner circle
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Closed polygon with rays from the center to each vertex

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: STARVERTICES=variable | (variable-list)] 
          
Superimposes a star (polygon) at each point on the primary chart.

Specifies that the estimate of the process standard deviation, σ, is to be calculated 
from subgroup standard deviations.

[Syntax: SUBGROUPN=value] 
          
Specifies the subgroup sample sizes as a constant value or as the values of a 
variable in the DATA= data set.

[Syntax: SYMBOLCHARS='character-list'] 
          
Specifies a list of characters used to mark the points plotted on line printer 
charts when a symbol-variable is used.
Controls the legend for the levels of a symbol-variable.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: You can specify SYMBOLLEGEND=LEGENDn, where n is the number of a LEGEND statement  defined previously.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Suppresses the default legend.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the order in which symbols are assigned for levels of the symbol-variable.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Assigns symbols to values in the order in which values appear in the input data set.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Assigns symbols based on sorted order of internal values of the symbol variable
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Assigns them based on sorted formatted values.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TABLE|TABLES | TABLES(EXCEPTIONS)|TABLE(EXCEPTIONS)]
          
Creates a basic table of the subgroup values, the subgroup sample sizes, the subgroup 
summary statistics, and the upper and lower control limits. Rows of the table correspond 
to subgroups. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which 
the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

Creates a basic table of the subgroup values, the subgroup sample sizes, the subgroup 
summary statistics, and the upper and lower control limits. Rows of the table correspond 
to subgroups. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which 
the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

[Syntax: TABLEALL | TABLEALL(EXCEPTIONS)]
          
Tabulates the information about the control chart and is equivalent to specifying all 
of the following options: TABLES, TABLECENTRAL, TABLEID, TABLELEGEND, TABLEOUT, and 
TABLETESTS. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for 
which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

Tabulates the information about the control chart and is equivalent to specifying all 
of the following options: TABLES, TABLECENTRAL, TABLEID, TABLELEGEND, TABLEOUT, and 
TABLETESTS. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for 
which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

[Syntax: TABLEBOX | TABLEBOX(EXCEPTIONS)] 
          
Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns for the minimum, 
25th percentile, median, 75th percentile, and maximum of the observations in a 
subgroup. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for 
which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns for the minimum, 
25th percentile, median, 75th percentile, and maximum of the observations in a 
subgroup. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for 
which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

[Syntax: TABLECENTRAL|TABLEC | TABLECENTRAL(EXCEPTIONS)|TABLEC(EXCEPTIONS)]
          
Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns for the values 
of the central lines. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those 
subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes 
is positive.

Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns for the values 
of the central lines. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those 
subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes 
is positive.

[Syntax: TABLEID | TABLEID(EXCEPTIONS)] 
          
Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with a column for each of the 
ID variables. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups 
for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with a column for each of the 
ID variables. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups 
for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

[Syntax: TABLELEGEND|TABLELEG | TABLELEGEND(EXCEPTIONS)|TABLELEG(EXCEPTIONS)]
          
Adds a legend to the basic table created by the TABLES option. The keyword EXCEPTIONS 
restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded 
or a test for special causes is positive.

Adds a legend to the basic table created by the TABLES option. The keyword EXCEPTIONS 
restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded 
or a test for special causes is positive.

[Syntax: TABLEOUTLIM|TABLEOUT | TABLEOUTLIM(EXCEPTIONS)|TABLEOUT(EXCEPTIONS)]
          
Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns indicating which 
control limits (if any) are exceeded. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation 
to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special 
causes is positive.

Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns indicating which 
control limits (if any) are exceeded. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation 
to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special 
causes is positive.

[Syntax: TABLETESTS | TABLETESTS(EXCEPTIONS)]
          
Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with a column that indicates 
which of the tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= option) are 
positive. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups 
for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is 
positive.

Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with a column that indicates 
which of the tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= option) are 
positive. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups 
for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is 
positive.

[Syntax: TARGET=value-list] 
          
Provides target values used to compute the capability index Cpm, which is saved in the OUTLIMITS= 
data set.

[Syntax: TEST2RESET=variable] 
          
Enables tests for special causes to be reset in a secondary chart. The specified 
variable must be a character variable of length 8, or length 16 if customized tests 
are requested.
Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 2 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: 7 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: 8 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: At least 10 out of 11 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: At least 12 out of 14 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: At least 16 out of 20 in a row

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 3 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Length of the pattern is at least 6.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Length of the pattern is at least 7.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Length of the pattern is at least 8.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= options 
be applied without regard to phases (blocks of consecutive subgroups) determined 
by the READPHASES= option and the variable _PHASE_ in the input data set.

[Syntax: TESTCHAR='character'] 
          
Specifies the character for the line segments that connect any sequence of points 
for which a test for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) 
is positive. The default character is the number of the test (with values 1 to 8).

[Syntax: TESTFONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for labels requested with the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, 
OUTLABEL=, OUTLABEL2=, STARLABEL=, TESTLABEL=, and TESTLABEL= options.

[Syntax: TESTHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height (in vertical percent screen units) for labels requested with 
the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL=, OUTLABEL2=, STARLABEL=, TESTLABEL=, and 
TESTLABEL= options.

Requests that labels for subgroups with positive tests for special causes are 
positioned so they do not overlap. The labels are enclosed in boxes that are 
connected to the associated subgroup points with line segments.
Provides labels for points at which one of the tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) is positive.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Labels points with the single-digit index that requested the test in a TESTS= or TESTS2= list.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Request a label of the form Test k.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: A label of up to 16 characters enclosed in quotes.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: A variable (enclosed in parentheses) whose values are used as labels. The variable must be provided  in the input data set, and it can be numeric or character.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Applies the tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options 
to standardize test statistics when the subgroup sample sizes are not constant.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Applies the tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options  to standardize test statistics when the subgroup sample sizes are not constant.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Applies tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) to 
overlapping patterns of points.

[Syntax: TESTRESET=variable] 
          
Enables tests for special causes to be reset in a primary chart. The specified 
variable must be a character variable of length 8, or length 16 if customized 
tests are requested.

[Syntax: TESTS=index-list] 
          
Requests one or more tests for special causes, which are also known as runs tests, 
pattern tests, and Western Electric rules.

[Syntax: TESTS2=index-list] 
          
Requests one or more tests for special causes for an R chart or s chart.

[Syntax: TESTSYMBOL=symbol] 
          
Specifies the symbol for plotting subgroups with positive tests for special causes.

[Syntax: TESTSYMBOLHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height of the symbol used to plot subgroups with positive tests for 
special causes.

[Syntax: TOTPANELS=n] 
          
Specifies the total number of panels to be used to display the chart. This option 
overrides the NPANEL= option.

[Syntax: TRENDVAR=variable | (variable-list)] 
          
Specifies a list of trend variables, one for each process listed in the chart statement.

Turns the labels produced by the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL= and OUTLABEL2= 
options so that they are strung out vertically.

Turns the major tick mark labels for the horizontal (group) axis so that they are 
strung out vertically. By default, labels are arranged horizontally.

Specifies the value of the _TYPE_ variable in the OUTLIMITS= data set, which in turn 
indicates whether certain parameter variables in this data set represent estimates 
or standard (known) values.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: _MEAN_=estimate, _STDDEV_=estimate
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: _MEAN_=standard, _STDDEV_=estimate

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: U0=value] 
          
Specifies a known (standard) value u0 for the average number u of nonconformities per unit produced 
by the process.

[Syntax: UCLLABEL='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the upper control limit in the primary chart. The label can be 
up to 16 characters. Enclose the label in quotes.

[Syntax: UCLLABEL2='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the upper control limit in the secondary chart. The label can be 
up to 16 characters. Enclose the label in quotes.

[Syntax: USL=value-list] 
          
Provides upper specification limits used to compute capability indices.
Specifies a label for the central line in a U chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: U
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: UBAR
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Uo
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: VAXIS=value-list | VAXIS=AXISn] 
          
Specifies major tick mark values for the vertical axis of a primary chart. The values 
must be listed in increasing order, must be evenly spaced, and must span the range of 
values displayed in the chart.

[Syntax: VAXIS2=value-list | VAXIS2=AXISn] 
          
Specifies major tick mark values for the vertical axis of a secondary chart. The 
values must be listed in increasing order, must be evenly spaced, and must span 
the range of values displayed in the chart.

[Syntax: VFORMAT=format] 
          
Specifies a format to be used for displaying tick mark labels on the vertical axis 
of a primary chart.

[Syntax: VFORMAT2=format] 
          
Specifies a format to be used for displaying tick mark labels on the vertical axis 
of a secondary chart.

[Syntax: VMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between major tick marks on the vertical 
axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, VMINOR=0.

[Syntax: VOFFSET=value] 
          
Specifies the length in percent screen units of the offset at the ends of the 
vertical axis.

[Syntax: VREF=value-list | VREF=SAS-data-set] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis on the primary chart.

[Syntax: VREF2=value-list | VREF2=SAS-data-set] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis on the secondary chart.

[Syntax: VREF2LABELS='label1' ...'labeln' ] 
          
Specifies labels for the reference lines requested by the VREF= option. The number 
of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can 
be up to 16 characters.

[Syntax: VREF2LABELS='label1' ...'labeln' ] 
          
Specifies labels for the reference lines requested by the VREF2= option. The number 
of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can 
be up to 16 characters.

[Syntax: VREFCHAR='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used for reference lines requested by the VREF= and VREF2= 
options on line printer charts. The default is the hyphen (-).
Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABEL= and VREF2LABEL= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Left-justified in subplot area
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Right-justified in subplot area

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Forces the origin to be included in the vertical axis for a primary chart.
Forces the origin to be included in the vertical axis for a secondary chart.

[Syntax: WAXIS=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels for the axis and frame lines. By default, n=1.

[Syntax: WEBOUT=SAS-data-set] 
          
Produces an output data set containing all the data in an OUTTABLE= data set plus 
graphics coordinates for points (subgroup summary statistics) that are displayed 
on a control chart.

[Syntax: WGRID=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels for grid lines requested with the ENDGRID and GRID 
options. By default, n=1.

[Syntax: WLIMITS=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels for the control limits and central line. By default, n=1.

[Syntax: WNEEDLES=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of needles connecting plotted points to the central line, 
as requested with the NEEDLES option.

[Syntax: WOVERLAY=(value-list)] 
          
Specifies the widths in pixels for the line segments connecting points on primary 
chart overlay plots.

[Syntax: WOVERLAY2=(value-list)] 
          
Specifies the widths in pixels for the line segments connecting points on secondary 
chart overlay plots.

[Syntax: WSTARCIRCLES=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the outline of circles requested by the STARCIRCLES= 
option.

[Syntax: WSTARS=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the outline of stars requested by the STARVERTICES= 
option.

[Syntax: WTESTS=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the line segments that connect patterns of points 
for which a test for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) 
is positive. By default, n=1.

[Syntax: WTREND=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the line segments that connect points on trend 
charts requested with the TRENDVAR= option. By default, n=1.
Specifies a label for the central line in an XBAR chart or a median chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: a quoted label up to 16 characters
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: MBAR
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: MU0
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: XBAR

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: YPCT1=value] 
          
Specifies a percent (ranging from 0 to 100) that determines the length of the 
vertical axis for the primary chart in proportion to the sum of the lengths of 
the vertical axes for the primary and secondary charts.

Scales the vertical axis on a P chart in percent units. The YSCALE= option is available 
only in the PCHART statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Scales the vertical axis on a P chart in percent units.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that a control chart is to be constructed and displayed regardless of whether 
the estimated process standard deviation is zero.
Suppresses the display of the degenerate limits.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Suppresses the display of the degenerate limits.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Adds the labels A, B, and C to zone lines requested with the ZONES2 or ZONE2VALUES options.

Labels R or s chart zones lines with their values. If the ZONE2VALUES option is 
specified the ZONES2 option is not required.

[Syntax: ZONECHAR='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used to form the zone lines requested by the ZONES option.
Adds the labels A, B, and C to zone lines requested with the ZONES or ZONEVALUES options.

Adds lines to a primary chart that delineate zones A, B, and C for standard tests 
requested with the TESTS= option.

Adds lines to an R or s chart that delineate zones A, B, and C for tests requested 
with the TESTS2= option.
Specifies the horizontal position of the ZONEVALUES= and ZONE2VALUES= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Left-justified in subplot area
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Right-justified in subplot area

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Labels the primary chart zones lines with their values. If the ZONEVALUES option 
is specified the ZONES option is not required.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: INSET keyword-list < / options >; 
      
The INSET statement enables you to enhance an ANOM chart by adding a box or table 
(referred to as an inset) of summary statistics directly to the graph. An inset can 
display statistics calculated by the ANOM procedure or arbitrary values provided in 
a SAS data set.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CFILL=color | BLANK] 
          
Specifies the color of the background (including the header background if you do not 
specify the CFILLH= option). CFILL=BLANK leaves the background uncolored and prevents 
items from showing through the inset.
Leaves the background uncolored and prevents items from showing through the inset.

[Syntax: CFILLH=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the header background. By default, if you do not specify 
a CFILLH= color, the CFILL= color is used.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the frame. By default, the frame is the same color as the 
axis of the plot.

[Syntax: CHEADER=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the header text. By default, if you do not specify a CHEADER= 
color, the CTEXT= color is used.

[Syntax: CSHADOW=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the drop shadow.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the text. By default, the inset text color is the same as the 
other text on the plot.

Specifies that data coordinates are to be used in positioning the inset with the 
POSITION= option.

[Syntax: FONT=font | SMALL] 
          
Specifies the font of the text. By default, the font is SIMPLEX if the inset is located 
in the interior of the plot, and the font is the same as the other text displayed on the 
plot if the inset is located in the exterior of the plot.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Replace font with an actual font name.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: When you specify FONT=SMALL, the GraphValueText font is used in the header and the  GraphDataText font is used in the inset body.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FORMAT=format] 
          
Specifies a format for all the values displayed in an inset.

[Syntax: HEADER= 'string'] 
          
Specifies the header text. The string cannot exceed 40 characters.
Specifies the height of the text.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies the height of the text in screen percent units. Replace value with an actual value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Reduces the size of the text in the inset. When you specify HEIGHT=SMALL, the GraphValueText  size is used for the inset header and the GraphDataText size is used in the inset body.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: HOPACITY=value] 
          
Specifies the inset header background opacity when transparency is used in ODS Graphics 
output. The value must be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is 
completely opaque. The default inset header background opacity is 0.35.
Suppresses the frame drawn around the text.

[Syntax: OPACITY=value] 
          
Specifies the inset background opacity when transparency is used in ODS Graphics output. The value 
must be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is completely opaque. The default 
inset background opacity is 0.95.

[Syntax: POSITION=position] 
          
Determines the position of the inset. The position can be a compass point keyword, a margin keyword, 
or a pair of coordinates (x,y). You can specify coordinates in axis percent units or axis data units.

Specifies the reference point for an inset that is positioned by a pair of coordinates 
with the POSITION= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Bottom right
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Bottom left
